alert.note: Alert for Stanton (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 29 at 7:37PM CDT until March 29 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CUMING...NORTH CENTRAL COLFAX AND SOUTHEASTERN STANTON COUNTIES... At 737 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles north of Howells, or 25 miles southeast of Norfolk, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Howells, 10 Miles West Of West Point and The Highway 15 And 32 Junction. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
